name: Annotated Bibliography Template
description: Annotated bibliography template with summary, evaluation, and reflection for each source

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
## Introduction

### Topic
[State your research topic]

### Purpose
This annotated bibliography provides a comprehensive review of sources related to [topic]. Each entry includes a citation, summary, evaluation, and reflection on the source's relevance to the research question.

### Research Question
[State your research question or focus]

### Scope
[Explain the scope and selection criteria for sources included]

sections.title: Entry 1
sections.content:
## Entry 1

### Citation
Author, A. A. (Year). *Title of work*. Publisher.

### Summary
[Provide a concise summary of the main arguments, findings, or themes of the source. What are the key points?]

### Evaluation
[Evaluate the source's credibility, relevance, and quality. Consider:
- Author's credentials and expertise
- Publication venue and peer review status
- Research methodology and evidence quality
- Strengths and limitations
- Potential biases]

### Reflection
[Reflect on how this source relates to your research:
- How does it contribute to your understanding of the topic?
- How does it relate to other sources?
- How will you use it in your research?]

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content:
## Conclusion

### Synthesis
[Synthesize the key themes and insights from your annotated sources]

### Research Gaps
[Identify any gaps in the literature based on your review]

### Next Steps
[Explain how this bibliography will inform your research project]

instructions: Use consistent citation format (APA, MLA, or Chicago)
Keep summaries concise (150-200 words per entry)
Provide critical evaluation, not just description
Organize entries alphabetically by author's last name
Explain the relevance of each source to your research
Add as many entries as needed for your assignment
